faq.title: Common Questions
faq.q1: Doesn't publishing a map of projects create a target list?
faq.a1: Every community listed here chose to be listed — the tradeoff between visibility and risk is theirs to make. Beyond that, our map shows needs, not existing infrastructure. We don't publish exact site coordinates, and access is geoblocked in Russia and Belarus.
faq.q2: How do I know my donation actually reaches Ukraine?
faq.a2: We provide wire transfer confirmations, on-site photos during installation, and live monitoring data once systems are operational. Every project has a public transparency report.
faq.q3: Who are your partners in Ukraine?
faq.a3: We work directly with municipal governments and licensed electrical contractors. All partners are vetted and have completed previous installations.
faq.q4: What if a project isn't funded in full?
faq.a4: Projects are funded in full by a single donor — that's how we guarantee completion. Some projects have co-financing partners covering up to 20%. For pooled or smaller donations, see our Municipal Partnership Program.
faq.a5: Yes. Donations are made to POCACITO Network, a registered 501(c)(3) (EIN 99-0392258). Your donation is tax-deductible as allowed by law.

about.title: About hromada
about.mission: hromada, "community" in Ukrainian, connects municipalities with donors to rebuild critical infrastructure, focusing on renewable energy and sustainability.
about.statementOfPurposeText: This platform serves as a transparent bridge between Ukrainian municipalities seeking support for renewable energy and infrastructure projects, and donors who want to make a direct, meaningful impact. Our goal is to restore the flow of support for the sustainable reconstruction of Ukrainian infrastructure in the wake of the cessation of aid by the United States government. The ultimate purpose is the decentralization of Ukraine's power grids and the building of sustainable resilience against Russian attacks on critical infrastructure.
about.howItWorksText: Ukrainian municipalities and NGO partners on the ground identify infrastructure projects that need funding. Each project is verified for legitimacy and impact before publication.
about.forPartnersText: Our partner organizations submit verified projects from municipalities they work with. Each project goes through a verification process before being published.
about.forDonorsText: Browse verified projects, filter by category, urgency, or location, and connect directly with communities to provide support.
about.directConnectionText: Donations are processed and transferred directly to the municipality. You always know exactly which project your contribution supports.
about.categoryIntro: Communities are requesting solar PVs, battery storage, heat pumps, and thermo-modernization for:
about.civilianOnly: All projects are strictly civilian infrastructure. We do not fund military or dual-use equipment.
about.contactText: Questions or feedback? Reach out to us at
about.ourPartnersText: Trusted NGO partners on the ground in Ukraine verify projects and facilitate connections between communities and donors.

contact.description: Have questions about the hromada platform? We're here to help.
contact.generalInquiriesText: For general questions about the platform, partnership opportunities, or other inquiries:
contact.forMunicipalitiesText: Ukrainian municipalities can submit infrastructure projects for donor matching through our platform.
contact.forDonorsText: Browse verified projects and use the contact form on each project page to express your interest in supporting a specific community.
contact.forPartnersText: Interested in becoming a verification partner? hromada works with trusted NGOs on the ground in Ukraine who verify and facilitate projects.
contact.forMediaText: For press inquiries, interviews, or media coverage requests, feel free to reach out.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.intro: We take trust seriously. Every project on hromada goes through a verification process to ensure authenticity and protect both donors and municipalities.
transparency.civilianOnlyText: hromada exclusively supports civilian infrastructure projects — hospitals, schools, water utilities, and renewable energy systems. We do not fund, facilitate, or support any military equipment, dual-use technology, or defense-related projects. Ukrainian communities are using this platform to maintain essential services and build sustainable energy independence.
transparency.verificationText: Each project submission is reviewed before publication. Municipality identity is confirmed, project details are verified, and information is checked for accuracy.
transparency.directConnectionText: Donations are processed and transferred directly to the municipality. Full transparency means you always know exactly which project and community your contribution supports.
transparency.partnersText: Trusted NGOs and organizations on the ground in Ukraine verify projects and facilitate connections between donors and communities.
transparency.processStep1Text: Municipality or NGO partner submits project
transparency.processStep2Text: Our team reviews and verifies details
transparency.processStep3Text: Approved projects go live on platform
transparency.faq1Answer: 100% of your donation goes directly to the municipality for the specified project. hromada does not take any transaction fees or overhead from donations. We are funded separately through grants and institutional support.
transparency.faq2Question: How do I know projects are real?
transparency.faq2Answer: Every project goes through a multi-step verification process. Trusted NGO partners on the ground in Ukraine verify municipality identities, project details, and needs. Documentation is reviewed and due diligence is conducted before any project is published.
transparency.faq3Question: Can I visit or see updates on my funded project?
transparency.faq3Answer: Yes! After funding is complete, municipalities provide updates and photos of project implementation. For larger donations, we can arrange virtual meetings with the municipality or, when safe, coordinate site visits.
transparency.faq4Answer: Ukraine's energy infrastructure has been systematically targeted. Communities are requesting solar, battery storage, and heat pumps to build decentralized, resilient energy systems that can't be taken out by a single attack. Every installation strengthens long-term energy independence.
transparency.faq5Answer: hromada operates through grants and institutional support from foundations committed to Ukrainian recovery. This allows us to pass 100% of individual donations directly to projects without administrative fees.

hero.title: Municipal Partnership Program
hero.subtitle: Ukraine's energy grid has been devastated by Russian attacks. Thousands of municipalities need solar panels, heat pumps, and battery storage — but have no way to reach international donors.
hero.pitch: The Municipal Partnership Program connects one American community with one Ukrainian community around one project. Real impact you can see and measure.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.step1Desc: Your community expresses interest through our form
howItWorks.step2Desc: We pair you with a Ukrainian municipality based on size, project type, and budget
howItWorks.step3Desc: Mayors and community leaders from both sides are introduced
howItWorks.step4Desc: Your community has 3–6 months to raise $7,500–$15,000 through local fundraising
howItWorks.step5Desc: Both communities receive photos, video, and monitoring data from the completed project

whyItWorks.title: Why It Works
whyItWorks.achievableDesc: $7,500–$15,000 is one Rotary grant, a couple fundraiser dinners, or a small line item in a city budget.
whyItWorks.collectiveDesc: You're not asking one donor for $15K — you're giving a whole community a shared mission.
whyItWorks.concreteDesc: Not "donate to Ukraine" but "fund a 36kW solar installation for Prylymanskyi Lyceum in Odesa."
whyItWorks.bridgesDesc: Both communities gain a real human connection. Mayors are introduced. Updates are shared. It's sister cities with a deliverable.
